info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:58PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sanders County through 130 PM MDT... At 1257 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thompson Falls. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Belknap. This includes Highway 200 W between mile markers 38 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
